intro: Pseudotectaria crinigera, commonly known as the hairy fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive fronds and growth habits. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features long, slender fronds with a hairy texture, which gives it its common name. Its rhizome is creeping and produces adventitious roots, aiding in its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The botanical structure of Pseudotectaria crinigera supports its role as an epiphytic or terrestrial plant in diverse ecosystems.
